revised_title: Sight-Feeding Habits and Brain Structure of Cyprinodont Fishes
tldr: The study examines the medulla oblongata of cyprinodont fishes, focusing on their surface-feeding habits. The research shows that these fish have a narrow medulla oblongata with small facial and vagal lobes, but a prominent central acoustic area, which is an auditory center in the brain. This structure is a result of their sight-feeding habits, making them more active and alert than bottom-feeding fish.
